title: Wells Fargo names Charles Scharf its new CEO, who previously led Bank of New York Mellon
text: Wells Fargo & Co. WFC, -0.79% has named Friday Charles Scharf as its chief executive, effective Oct. 21, to end a 6-month search for a head of the bank. Scharf was most recently Bank of New York Mellon Corp.'s BK, -0.55% chairman and CEO, and had also previously served as Visa Inc.'s V, +0.21% CEO. Scharf succeeds Allen Parker, who was appointed interim-CEO in March. Wells Fargo's stock rose 0.8% in premarket trading, while Bank of New York Mellon shares were still inactive. Separately, Bank of New York Mellon said it named Thomas Gibbons as interim-CEO, effective immediately. Gibbons, a 30-year veteran of the bank, was most recently vice chairman and CEO of clearing, markets and client management. Wells Fargo's stock has gained 6.1% year to date through Thursday and Bank of New York Mellon shares have slipped 0.9%, while the SPDR Financial Select Sector ETF XLF, -0.46% has rallied 17.4% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -0.30% has gained 15.3%.
